Reviews.Title: “Small, clean hotel with a GREAT breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: nyc10019
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night in this hotel during a long (24 hour) layover in Istanbul. Very close to the metro line from the airport and the tram that can take you around the city. It is about a 15 to 20 minute walk to the major sites in the Sultanahmet district. The rooms were compact but very efficient and just fine for 2 people. The bathroom was small but well appointed. Good wifi and very helpful at the front desk, The best part is the free breakfast ~ what a spread! We went through the buffet twice so we could sample everything and it was all delicious. We tried to book in again when we returned to Istanbul the following week but sadly they were full as it was Easter week. Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A surprizing boutique hotel close to the old town”
Reviews.Author: diana_ro
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay in this boutique hotel! A very good breakfast nice rooms (although not very big). We would definitely come back !

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, comfortable, elegant”
Reviews.Author: AIIK
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, much better than expected. Rooms were small and cosy and they had the best showers! Location is great as there are many touristic sites at close walking distance and plenty of shops for those shopaholics. Really nice atmosphere with very friendly staff (and a cute manager ;) ) Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “just perfect !!”
Reviews.Author: Catherine-Tate
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for four nights. We were in the 6th floor and we think it was better than in first -second floor because there was noise from traffic almost all day. The room was small but very good for two person. It was very very clean and the mattresses were perfect.Breakfast was tasty and you had to choose between many things.This hotel is in old town and it was easy to reach many monuments on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, amateurish management”
Reviews.Author: dcp772000
Reviews.Content: Pro: - Newly furnished and well decorated rooms, especially the bathrooms are very tasteful (as much as I am thinking to buy the same tiles for my house). Overall you have the feeling to be at least in a 4 stars when you are in the room. You have some nice touches like complementary slippers. - Good breakfast, for such a small hotel, there is a bit of everything and of good quality. And the waiters are really taking care of the room and guests. - 50 meter from the tram stop, that takes you to the airport (with one change) or through most of the tourist destinations - 300 meters from the metro line that goes directly to the airport - Just off one of the main streets of old Istanbul. Within a 20 minutesâ€™ walk you have the vast majority of tourist attraction and places to eat - Some of the staff is very attentive and nice Contra: - Our room was of normal size, but some I have seen passing by are really tiny, so I suppose it is a matter of luck. The only serious complaint I have is to the management: 1)You put a kettle with 2 tea bags and 2 instant coffees in the room and do not restock them? When we asked to get 2 tea bags at our 3rd day of stay, we were told that we could not as the policy was not to refill? Great move!! You saved something in the region of 0.05 lira and got two annoyed customers. 2) Even although most of your personnel are very good, some of them treats you like you are a nuisance. In particular I am referring to the man at reception the morning and early afternoon of the 8th of November (I was not able to see his badge). All the times we encountered this person during our stay, we have been not only ignored repeatedly, but he did act really annoyed of us just passing by, as if we were disturbing his internet browsing session. Now this is my review number 48, and I think it is the first time I bother to complaint about rude staff, but if this is his attitude, he should not work in the hospitality industry. 3) Sort out your reception area: even if you are short of space, it looks like a 1 star motel; with wooden boards holding up printers and generally messy. Not at all reflecting how nice the rest of the hotel is. If I had not already booked, I would have walked away.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: pajibhut
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay close to the Grand Bazar this hotel is definitely an outstanding one. We walked to the Bazar and it took about 10 to 15 minutes at most. The room was very clean modernly decorated. We were very pleased with the service. The attendents were very courteous and helpful in every way. The breakfast was very delicious and had good variety. There were also lot of choises to eat at nearby locations. I will definitely consider this hotel if I go back to Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable but cramped”
Reviews.Author: Abzen2007
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is in the older part of the town (Aksaray) which is quite crowded. To go to Sultanahmet one can take a tram (there's a tram stop right near the hotel) - cheap and convenient. The room, as other reviews point out, are quite small but clean, and there's no nice view from the room. Its nice for couples but if you have a lot of luggage, it feels cramped. The lift/elevator is tiny and moves at a very slow pace.....I felt claustrophobic in it, so I often took the spiraling stairs. The breakfast was really good with variety of fruits yogurt and breads. The waiters were attentive and courteous and helpful. The manager of the hotel was a little curt and rude regarding our schedule of stay at the hotel.....I had made a cancellation on Booking.com and then changed the dates for this hotel which the manager of the hotel did not like. Most employees understood English, at least the basics.

Reviews.Title: “Good starting point for Old Istanbul sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: polarwombat
Reviews.Content: Location is a definite strength of the Polatdemir hotel - one gets on the metro in the Airport, one gets out in Aksaray. I wondered how the hotel could fit into such a narrow building, but it does. A visitor has an access to all features required from the 3* hotel - including a very decent breakfast. Rooms are very small, but comfy, I liked the bed and a clean bathroom - but mind you, if one is sensitive to the issue of available space, an episode of claustrophobia is likely. Within a walking distance from the hotel one can find a T1 tram station (to Sultanahmet), a metro terminal (to the airport) and a couple of bus stops convenient if you want to cross the Golden Horn. Lots of other hotels in the vicinity, but I think that Polatdemir is a right choice for a budget-conscious tourist. One serious downside of the hotel that I found really annoying: wifi internet connection is completely unreliable and the hotel staff, otherwise helpful, failed to do anything with that during my 5-day stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic & super clean”
Reviews.Author: Bull_vs_Dog
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely worth its price! It is very small (6 rooms per floor, 6 floors total), so are the rooms (good for 1 person, a bit tight for two) but super clean, with an excellent bathroom and a very fine bed. Very essential, but with a safe and air conditioning. The breakfast is rich, thought a bit monotonous. Bar is a plus. I was not charged extra for 2 local calls, which is also a great plus. WiFi did not work well, which is a minus. Location is strategic: you are 10 min walk from the Blue Mosque. The tram stop is just round the corner. And you're in the market heart of Istambul in case you hunt for cheap shopping. All very fine for a small hotel and price/quality ration.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalistic rooms but nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Naguizz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at polatdemir last year 2010 in march. To cut it short, rooms are small, just enough for two people to fit in there. Location is not the best as everyone was telling me, but we did not see or face anything disturbing. Breakfast was good, it needs more than one elevator, but i woud be surprised if they manage to fit another. Transport to and from the airport was easy, since it is the last station on the metro line going to the airport,a 30 mins ride to ataturk airport. A small walk to the nearest tramway as well. W enjoyed our stay there, and the deal was good as well, 60 euros for a double room. I would recommend this hotel to young couples as older ones would find it hard to move in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: doucheadvisor
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid (75 euro/night) this was an excellent hotel! Our double room, though not large, was very comfortable. The bathroom was well designed, cleaning staff were efficient, and the included buffet breakfast was quite good. The location of the hotel is convenient, especially for the first time visitor to Istanbul, as it is right off the main tram line, making it very easy for one to get to the historic centre and north of the Bosphorus. One negative point is that, if your room faces the street, as there is a mosque very close by, you may be awoken in the morning during prayer time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, value for money”
Reviews.Author: EgoFuzzyLogic
Reviews.Content: Looks lil tight but feel ok. Clean. Nice personnel. Good breakfast. 10 min walk to Sultan Ahmet or 3 min by tram

Reviews.Title: “Friendly lovely atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Hellothergorgeous
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, the location fabulous, the room clean and staff helpful. We were stuck there during the ashcloud saga and the hotel accommodated us for 3 extra nights for the same price by night, eventhough we could see that there was great demand. Throughout our stay the staff have been very helpful and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with the best breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: MCBes
Reviews.Content: Polatdemir is a nice hotel with a superb breakfast! We had a double bed room, very small, better is to have two single beds because those rooms are larger. The hotel is situated in the more Russian area of Istanbul (mostly Russian tourists and shops) but a 20 minute walk takes you to the Blue Mosque and Aya Sophia. And the trams stops just around the corner, it takes you just a few minutes to the mosques or other parts of Istanbul. The hotel is clean, with a large safe in the room (larger as usual!), fridge, hairblower, and the bathrooms are very nive. Nice staff. But the best is the breakfast! Such an enormous variety of food! All kinds of bread, eggs, sausages, cheese, fruit, yoghurt, drinks. Delicious! A very good hotel for this price.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: 30Lasy
Reviews.Content: As the hotel is quite ok, good breakfast and location, you must be aware of your things. Before you live your room hide ALL your things or just take it with you. (as we have learned from the manager - that it is our problem that the things dissapear - I am curious what kind of advise ha had to that couple whose new shoes dissapeard). I also recommend to the manager of the hotel to put bigger safeboxes in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: dxb625
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel around midnight, got off the metro at Aksaray (it is quite tricky to navigate across the expressway at night, especially if you have a lot to carry. I strongly suggest switching from the metro to the tram at zeytinburnu station, then alight at akasaray tram stop. Although it will cost an additional1.50 TL, I know I'll get to the hotel alive ). Staff at the front desk was friendly and spoke good English. Hotel was full on the night we checked in so we did not get a double bed but 2 twin beds. Spoke to the front desk and they switched rooms for us when we were out sightseeing. Moved our belongings to the new room, even our beverages from the minibar. The rooms are clean, new and nicely furnished. We checked out on our 5th day in Istanbul to go to Cappadocia and returned on the 8th night to the same hotel around midnight again. The second time we checked in, we got upgraded to the Advar suite. The suite was perhaps 1/3 bigger than the ordinary rooms but the furnishings were the same, except for the king size bed, the much bigger LCD tv and the bath robes in the bathroom. I don't know what is the going rate for that suite we were in but we would say the odrinary rooms were more than sufficient for our stay in Istanbul. By the way, Aksaray is the nearest tram stop to this hotel, but the location of this hotel is within walking distance from the major sights in the city (except Taksim)

Reviews.Title: “stay at polatdemir hotel”
Reviews.Author: Karolina89
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was very good ,very clean,polite hotel staff,not too big rooms but perfect for a couple,nice clean modern bathroom,tv and lots of different channels for foreign tourists,lovely views from windows. And it is 3 star hotel which in UK would be rated at least 4 stars if not more.Breakfast was very lovely as well and its a buffet where you choose what you want to eat and a good quality of food. So overall i would most definitely come back there again.Thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Nfly79
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel. Place near the road interchange. Some importunate district, but you can pass this streets by tram or bus. Three tram station to the Sutltanahmet square.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy hotell with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Palern
Reviews.Content: We payed 50 euro per night for a double room. Not bad. Close to the centrum (Sultanahmet). The breakfast was good and the staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVED IT- combination of good price and quality”
Reviews.Author: alidaByblos
Reviews.Content: i booked online, the room matched my request,luckily the breakfast was great , the room was clean and well prepared, great location because i found the the old city is way more interesting than the taksim square especially that its so close to everything as well,,, i advice it to everyone seeking the best combination of quality,location and price

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Polatdemir
HotelInfo.Address: Aksaray Street No 7 | Laleli, Istanbul 34130, Turkey
